description: Manages a Blob within a Storage Container.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

AccessTier.description: The access tier of the storage blob. Possible values are `Archive`, `Cool` and `Hot`.

ContentType.description: The content type of the storage blob. Cannot be defined if `source_uri` is defined. Defaults to `application/octet-stream`.

Metadata.description: A map of custom blob metadata.

Name.description: The name of the storage blob. Must be unique within the storage container the blob is located.

Parallelism.description: The number of workers per CPU core to run for concurrent uploads. Defaults to `8`.

Size.description: Used only for `page` blobs to specify the size in bytes of the blob to be created. Must be a multiple of 512. Defaults to 0.

Source.description: An absolute path to a file on the local system. This field cannot be specified for Append blobs and cannot be specified if `source_content` or `source_uri` is specified.

SourceContent.description: The content for this blob which should be defined inline. This field can only be specified for Block blobs and cannot be specified if `source` or `source_uri` is specified.

SourceUri.description:
The URI of an existing blob, or a file in the Azure File service, to use as the source contents
for the blob to be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. This field cannot be specified for Append blobs and cannot be specified if `source` or `source_content` is specified.

StorageAccountName.description:
Specifies the storage account in which to create the storage container.
Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

StorageContainerName.description: The name of the storage container in which this blob should be created.

Type.description: The type of the storage blob to be created. Possible values are `Append`, `Block` or `Page`. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
